Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with Orpheus or perhaps Apollo under a tree, playing the lyre. The shoulder has a channel interrupted by a rectangular panel each side. At the rear is a ring handle. The lamp stands on a raised base. The nozzle is broken.
Curator's comments: An Egyptian version of a Channel-and-Panel lamp.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2074)
